title: Audio post numero uno
body: All my fingers were temporarily broken today, so I created the first, and possibly last, Moxie audio post. Download it here.
author: Dan

comments.author: whitty
comments.body: Wicked awesome!

comments.author: Aaron Scott
comments.body: Brilliant! I want more, but only when I'm at work. I won't wait forever, you know.

comments.author: Nicole
comments.body: So this is what Dan does when I leave him alone for a few hours...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: You should listen to it as you sleep... seriously.

comments.author: Ole
comments.body: Ooh, Danny's a podcaster!

comments.author: Ole
comments.body: and since his fingers are temporarily broken (packing for the wedding?) then follow the link under the URL banner to the News-Leader article today about your favorite theatre to be.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
awesomeness... except for 'bloggerinos'
you need to start a pirate radiostation

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
i have this urge to patronize the moxie cinema.. not in a bad way.. but as in be a patron there and spend all my money there... is that just me?
i better go to the atm

comments.author: Rachel
comments.body: Hey when am I gettin' that arm and a leg t-shirt?  Man, I want answers...I don't care if you don't like my tone!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Ole: I need to post something about that article. It really made us sound pathetic, didn't it.

Brian: I'm glad you caught that. Now listen to it while you sleep... or on the way to the ATM.

Rachel: The t-shirts should be here soon. I already have the buttons. I'm just waiting on the shirts and stickers.

comments.author: Stephanie
comments.body: Oh, good...I was worried the shirts were lost in the mail.

comments.author: Nicki J
comments.body:
That was freaking awesome. I want mooooore. 

Except that part at the end.

That was just creepy.

comments.author: Laura
comments.body: I love the audio post.  Keep 'em coming.

comments.author: Surferbill
comments.body:
brian of moore: I have that odd feeling too... and I don't know why (maybe it's my bloggery nose) but I feel the need to donate all my money to Moxie cinema. The Moxie cinema is great!

Unfortunately I have no money left since I spent it all on flights to Springfield, MO for the opening of Moxie cinema in late 2004, February and March.

:-p

comments.author: justin
comments.body: Yes.... brilliant!

comments.author: Emily
comments.body: Brilliance!  More, please.

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: Cool radio voice.

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: Not at all like that girly voice you had in that TV interview I watched a while back.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Thanks for noticing my manly husk, Oz. I made the audio post for the sole purpose of proving to everyone that my voice doesn't sound like a frog prince.

comments.author: nicholas
comments.body: oh man, dial-up is killing me...I may provide a transcript of this post to save the other dial-up folk (i'm travelling).

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I'm sure they'd appreciate that.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
Dan, you're a freakin' genius. And a freak. But mostly a genius.

I've been considering a leap into the podcasting world, but I'm now convinced I first need my own theme song / jingle. Must get working on that. (But not till after my exams...)

And Oz is right, your voice was much better in that. Not as good as Nicole's though. She sounded hot!

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: great. i got that damned jingle stuck in my head now.

comments.author: matt
comments.body: oooooooooh, i don't know.  stick with the written word, dan.  the humor works better on the page than in my ears.  but don't worry, i've thought the same thing about every blog that i've read that's become an audioblog.  a blog is in itself sort of self-absorbed, but when you know someone took the time to produce an audio segment, it just gets embarrassing! :)

comments.author: Liz
comments.body:
Hahahaha! That was excellent.

Hey, my roommate was asleep while I listened to this, so now she will patronize the Moxie cinema because it's great and deserves all her money. And maybe she'll stop making fun of your grammar and my inability to analyze poetry! (One can only hope.)
